children.subject: From the petition: "Late changes to the summer schedule will not apply to the policy in affect for the fall and spring semesters. All late changes will be approved and will not count towards the fall and spring late change limit."

Top of page 2: "Late changes to the summer schedule will not apply to the policy in affect for the fall and spring semesters. All late changes will be approved and will not count towards the fall and spring late change limit. "

It looks like you'll be able to use a late change in summer even if you've already used one in a fall or spring semester
What if we have used our late change before? Can we still use our late change this summer?
As that is a summer sessions deadline, please contact their office for clarification :)

http://summer.berkeley.edu/registration/schedule

According to this I have until Jul 27 to change my grading options but I currently can't. Can someone please explain?
I'm afraid not. Like all deadlines, it's dependent on the college you belong to. Please connect with your ESS Adviser to see if any options exist for you.
Sure, thanks for your response Nicole!
Would this apply for a CoE student towards a class offered by an L&S department? Or does the student’s major also have to be in L&S?

It would not be an incomplete. Those must be negotiated with the Professor. 

It would either disappear or say "Late drop by petition" (L&S or the Registrar could confirm). Either way, you could repeat.

Does dropping before the aug 8th deadline mean it disappears from your transcript or that is marked as incomplete? I’m wondering for sake of declaring if I used my emergency drop this summer if I could still take again in fall to declare. Thanks!
Like above, I'm not sure if the withdrawal will be listed. L&S, summer sessions, or the Registrar should be able to confirm. Either way, as long as the course is dropped, you can repeat.
Does withdrawal count as late change of schedule? If I submit the withdrawal form now(already pass the deadline of withdrawal), will it be approved?
bump^

Contact L&S if you need to follow up on your withdrawal. When you withdraw, all of your classes are dropped so this is a late change.

If you have advising questions about this that are related to CS, please email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. Advisors are no longer closely monitoring Piazza for advising and we are asking students to contact us directly via the alias.

If I need to drop my only course this summer, submitting a withdrawal for the course, will that appear on my transcript, and will I be able to repeat the course in the fall? 

Is the answer to this question the same before and after the withdrawal deadline for summer sessions (does the late summer change petition apply to withdrawals?) 

Thank you!
377 and 315 Soda Hall

Where are the drop in hours for summer held? 

Thank you :)
Only the financial aid office course answer that question.
How will this affect my financial aid since it's after the drop with refund deadline?
Yes, you're still welcome to drop. If you haven't completed the pre-reqs, we will deny your application (no biggie), and you should just resubmit in Fall.

If we submitted the CS Major petition already for the summer term, is it alright to late drop the last class needed to declare?

If so, I can modify the form to indicate I'll be taking my last prereq in the Fall instead of the Summer to help avoid confusion, since I'm not sure if it's possible to withdraw the major petition.

Thanks!
It would be best to check with L&S for this, as it's not directly related to EECS
For those still wondering: I contacted both Summer Sessions and L&S. L&S said they'll process the withdrawal!
Just to make sure. Any withdrawal after the official normal deadline will also be granted, right?

If you withdraw/late drop a class, it's like you never took it so it would not count toward the retake rules. This would only apply if you completed the course.

If you have advising questions about this that are related to CS, please email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. Advisors are no longer closely monitoring Piazza for advising and we are asking students to contact us directly via the alias.
So the late drop deadline is only for L&S and not for COE?
Would I be able to late drop CS70 and retake it in the fall or spring or would I be unable to do this because of the retake rules for lower division courses?

You should do both the form & the withdrawal request. Note you don't need our signature if you are not yet declared in CS.

If you have advising questions about this that are related to CS, please email cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu. Advisors are no longer closely monitoring Piazza for advising and we are asking students to contact us directly via the alias.

Just to make everything clear, if we aren't declared, is the deadline for the form & withdrawal request via CalCentral August 10 at 4 pm and not August 8 at 4 pm (I was told by an advisor that August 8 was the deadline, so I want to make sure)?
Please refer to the form.

For the line that says, "Note: students who are dropping their only course in summer 2018 must submit a withdrawal through CalCentral,"

does this mean that if we're only taking 1 course this summer, we would not fill out the form above and instead fill out a withdrawal request form on CalCentral?
As it's an L&S form/policy/deadline, I would suggest confirming with them.

I agree, it's confusing. I spoke with them yesterday and they said at this point, to just use the paper form since the deadline passed to withdraw via CalCentral. But yes, as Nicole said, you'll want to get clarification from them. They didn't mention CalCentral issues yesterday, I'm guessing since the deadline had already passed.

Hi,

I opened a ticket with SIS and they have fixed the online issue, so students can now submit a withdrawal form for the summer term (before, only the fall term showed up as an option to withdraw from).

Hi, 

To clarify, if we are trying to withdraw from Summer Sessions this week, we will not be able to do so on CalCentral anymore, but as long as we have turned in our late drop form to L&S by the August 10th 4pm deadline, it won't matter that we cannot withdraw online anymore, correct? 

I am only confused because when I turned in my late drop form to L&S this morning, they told me there were issues with CalCentral's withdrawal for the summer and that they were working on fixing it, which implied to me that I still needed to withdraw online at some point. 

Thanks!
As it's an L&S form/policy/deadline, I would suggest confirming with them. My understanding that the deadline is firm, regardless of when your final is.
I noticed that the drop deadline is August 10th, which is after the final for a lot of classes. Does this mean that we can turn in our late change of schedule after we take our final?

I just went to Evans today and asked the person working there and he said that if you just submit the digital form that’s all you have to do! Maybe just make sure that they received it if you want to be extra cautious but you probably don’t have to take extra steps.
Please refer all questions to your college.

I sent the withdrawal form from CalCentral after August 3 to drop my only class and it was being processed so I didn't take further action. But reading this post, should I also submit the paper form to make sure I can drop the class?

history.content:
Dear Students:

Initially, the Petition for Late Change of Schedule forms were only intended for use in fall and spring semesters. However, the College of Letter and Science is now allowing use of the form for the summer term. Students who wish to make late changes (add, drop, grading change) to their schedule for courses in which they are enrolled in summer can do so by completing a Petition for Late Change of Summer Schedule 2018.  This form must be signed by your major advisor(s) and then submitted to L&S for review. 

Note: students who are dropping their only course in summer 2018 must submit a withdrawal through CalCentral. The withdrawal deadline in CalCentral was August 3, 2018. If you're planning to withdrawal this week, you need to do the paper form attached and submit to L&S by Aug 10 at 4PM for Session C; they will process the withdrawal for you.

Deadline to get the form signed by a CS Advisor is 4:00pm on the following dates:

Session A: June 27, 2018

Sessions B-E: August 8, 2018

Please plan accordingly. Schedule an appointment through CalCentral or visit us during drop in hours on Wednesdays from 10am -12pm and 1pm-4pm.
history.subject: Late Summer Change of Schedule for Sum 2018
